Title: Genome-scale variant calling with reproducible workflows in human cohorts
Abstract: We processed sequencing cohorts using containerized pipelines and evaluated scalability, reproducibility, and turnaround time across multiple workflow configurations.
FundingText: Computational resources were provided by UPPMAXthrough national allocations. Support for Computational Resources enabled access to shared storage and batch execution. We thank name12 lastname12

Title: High-throughput docking prioritization for protein–ligand screening
Abstract: We performed large-scale docking and prioritization to select candidates for wet-lab validation, focusing on robustness to scoring noise and replicate stability.
FundingText: Compute time was provided on Dardel

Title: Reproducible transcriptomics benchmarking across preprocessing choices
Abstract: We benchmarked preprocessing pipelines for transcriptomics and reported sensitivity to filtering and normalization choices using standardized evaluation scripts.
FundingText: The analyses used allocations from Swedish National Infrastructure for Computing (SNIC).
FundingAgencies: Swedish National Infrastructure for Computing; SNIC

Title: Scalable single-cell quality control with transparent reporting
Abstract: We developed scalable single-cell quality control routines and summarized reporting templates to improve transparency and reuse across projects.
FundingText: Uppsala Multidisciplinary Center for Advanced Computational Science provided computational resources and user support for batch execution.
FundingAgencies: Uppsala Multidisciplinary Center for Advanced Computational Science

Title: Literature mining for biomarker curation with reproducible notebooks
Abstract: We implemented a reproducible literature-mining pipeline and evaluated extraction quality for biomarker curation tasks using standardized annotation guidelines.
FundingText: This work was enabled by national compute allocations for text processing and indexing.

Title: Nationwide integration of multi-site omics metadata for reproducible reuse
Abstract: We harmonized metadata across sites and evaluated interoperability practices for omics datasets, emphasizing provenance, documentation, and reuse.
FundingText: User support and coordination were provided by NBIS.

Title: Workflow training outcomes for reproducible data analysis in biosciences
Abstract: We assessed learning outcomes from workflow training and documented practices that improve reproducibility in routine data analysis.
FundingText: Training and user support were provided by the SciLifeLab Bioinformatics Platform. We thank name15 lastname15
AuthorKeywords: training evaluation; reproducible analysis; workflow practices; user support; documentation

Title: Large-scale topic modeling of historical newspapers for digital humanities
Abstract: We analyzed large collections of historical newspapers using topic modeling and evaluated stability across sampling and preprocessing choices.
FundingText: Compute resources were provided through NAISS allocations for large-scale text processing.

Title: Risk-adjusted portfolio evaluation under changing market regimes
Abstract: We evaluated model stability under regime shifts and compared performance across multiple portfolio construction approaches.

Title: Benchmarking large-scale simulation kernels for particle track reconstruction
Abstract: We benchmarked simulation kernels and assessed throughput as a function of batch size and memory access patterns.
FundingText: Computational resources were provided by UPPMAX under national allocations.
